segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's frustrating to see the water just keep flowing, creating a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are taking advantage of the situation, trying to get cookies without her noticing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar, and it's infuriating to see such recklessness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the girl is encouraging him, waiting for her share of the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The outside garden looks so calm and well-maintained, unlike the indoor chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why the woman doesn't just turn off the faucet and pay attention to what's going on around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water keeps overflowing, and the puddle grows larger, but she doesn't seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of irritation watching the boy risk his safety for some cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it's about to tip over, and it's maddening to see such carelessness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel annoyed at the woman's obliviousness and the children's recklessness.
segments.speaker: PAR
